framework.name: UN Sudan Common Approach Result Framework for 2024 - 2025

children.name: Outcome 1.1: By 2025, the populations in vulnerable situations have improved health, nutrition, education, water and sanitation, and social protection outcomes
Output 1.1.1: Targeted population have improved access to and use of quality preventive and curative health and nutrition services.
Output 1.1.2:  Targeted population have improved access to/and use of safe and adequate WASH services
Output 1.1.3: Equitable access to quality education is improved for school-aged children and youths
Output 1.1.4: National and sub-national government partners have strengthened institutional capacities to develop and deliver child and women-sensitive social protection, particularly to children and

Outcome 1.2: By 2023, people in Sudan, with emphasis on small producers and micro-entrepreneurs, have access to improved productive capacities  that contribute to inclusive and sustainable livelihoods
Output 1.2.1 Government institutions have strengthened capacities for evidence-informed policy formulation to promote priority setting and appropriate practices for sustainable economic development
Output 1.2.2 Targeted populations increasded  productived capacities
Output 1.2.3 Rural institutions and businesses are strengthened to promote socio-economic development
Outcome 1.3: By 2025, people in Sudan, with growth in entrepreneurship, technology development for research and innovation, and access to small-scale industrial enterprises through financial services
Output 1.3.1:  increased access of target populations to improved manugaturing productive capacity
Output 1.3.2:  Target populations benefited from vocational training  environmental technologies and innovations by local private microfinance.
Output 1.3.3: Target populations have increase access to infrastucture assets, soalr energy and manage solid waste.

Outcome 2.1: By the end of 2025, people of Sudan, including conflict-affected and other marginalized populations have enhanced prevention and protection against all forms of human rights and internati
Output 2.1.1: Enhanced knowledge of conflict-affected populations on human rights, refugee law and international humanitarian law for improved protection and access to justice outcomes.

Output 2.1.2: Increased access of conflict-affected populations and other vulnerable populations to facilities providing humane and safe reception, protection and response services and pathways to dur
Output 2.1.3: Increased access of conflict-affected populations and other vulnerable populations to justice and rule of law and localized reconciliation mechanisms according to custom and tradition.

Outcome 2.2: By the end of 2025, national, state, and local institutions’ systems and capacities are improved to respect and promote human rights, freedoms, and justice for service delivery and rule o
Output 2.2.1: Targeted legislative, policy frameworks and practice aligned with international standards and norms on human rights, refugee rights, non-discrimination, gender and age equality, and the

Output 2.2.2  Strengthened capacities of local institutions, local protection networks, civil society  to advocate  and develop evidence-based policies and mechanisms ensuring access to protection and
Output 2.2.3 Strengthened capacities of national, state and community-based institutions/mechanisms to respond timely, effectively and accountably to violations and abuses of IHRL, IHL, refugee law.
Output 2.2.4: Promote conflict sensitivity amongst conflict affected population and promote adherence to protection-centred outcomes.

Outcome 3.1:  By the end of 2025, analysis is conducted and tailored solutions are introduced to address drivers of inter- and intra-group violence; prevent conflict; and increase peaceful co-existenc
Output 3.1.1: Conflict Analysis: Continuous conflict analysis conducted and key insights on drivers and root causes of conflict developed.
Output 3.1.2: Conflict Prevention: Enhanced capacities of local stakeholders in identifying and mitigating potential conflict causes to prevent violence.
Output 3.1.3: Social Cohesion: Peace infrastructure strengthened for promoting social cohesion and peaceful co-existence (including between IDPs and host communities).
Output 3.1.4 : Hate speech: Information integrity promoted to address hate speech, misinformation and polarization
Outcome 3.2: By the end of 2025, civilian actors in conflict zones have their capacities strengthened to actively contribute to local-level peace-making initiatives.
Output 3.2.1: Strengthened capacities of civilian actors in conflict zones on insider mediation, dialogue, peace-making, and conflict transformation
Output 3.2.2: Monitoring capacities and mechanisms developed to monitor local ceasefires, document and address violations, and build trust between conflict parties
Outcome 3.3: By the end of 2025, civilian actors have enhanced meaningful participation in conflict transformation processes and fora at all levels.
Output 3.3.1: Key civilian perspectives and needs, including women, youth, victims and survivors of conflict-related violence, identified
Output 3.3.2: Conflict-affected civilian actors within Sudan capacitated to meaningfully participate in negotiations on peacebuilding and political transition

Output 3.3.3: Participation of civilian actors, including women, youth, victims and survivors of the conflict, in all levels of peace mediation processes (Track 1-3) and renewed transition negotiation
